book.Name: Andy Bateman
book.Message: I hope this site is what you imagined, i'm sorry you're not here to check it and tell me how I can make it betterâ€¦

book.Name: Sim Johnson
book.Message: Ive so many happy memories of Sam. I first met him whilst working at Huish when speaking to a couple of students who appeared not to be working very hard. Sam was listening to a MiniDisc, in those a days a not so popular gadget, and I was most impressed with his as it was a better model than mine!  I think he was downloading music files from the Internet, im sure i would have told him off.  I never imagined that he would soon be staff there, or ever move into my house.

book.Name: Sim Johnson
book.Message: Im sure many people have memories of Sam's driving. Sam had a memory of my driving too. He would mention this each time there was any sugestion of me driving him anywhere. One night i was driving Sam and the route took us through some twisty country lanes. Perhaps driving slightly fast Sam told me that i was making him feel ill, and thinking that he was joking I continued.  Only when he shouted for me to stop the car and he got out and ran to the hedge did i know he was serious. Since then Sam always tries to drive me, especialy on trips to McDonalds!

book.Name: Laura Nikiel
book.Message:
I think the first time I met Sam, was when Shaun and I decided to treat Sam, and my brother and sister, to a trip to the cinema.

I'd been seeing Shaun for a few months by then - so I should have been prepared for the Nikiel boys' charm. But Sam surprised me by positioning himself between Shaun and me for the whole movie, and holding my hand on the way out. At some point in the afternoon, I remember, he even whispered that he loved me!

A proper little Romeo - and he must have been all of 7 years old.

book.Name: Maureen Phillips
book.Message:
I want to say something about my son, Sam, and want the world to know what a wonderful young man he was.

From a very young age, Sam captured people's hearts with his singing and musical ability, playing his Yamaha organ. He had a starring role in his school's musical. His voice was like an angel's at the age of just ten.

Sam progressed with his music for a few years, learning to read music and taking exams. However, much to my annoyance, he continued to play most of his music by ear!

Sam was the joker in the family; always ready to give us a laugh. He loved anything technical, becoming very frustrated with me when attempting to teach me basics such as operating the video, central heating etc.

Sadly, Sam never knew his biological father and when I met Colin and married in 1991, he was overjoyed that he had gained a father and another brother in Adrian.

His brother Shaun was always close to Sam. They had the normal love-hate relationship that brothers have growing up, but in later years they became very close and I know that Shaun will miss him very much.

The worst thing about death is that it seems so final. But it is not. We have our memories and thank God for these.

Sam will be remembered every day and in my heart forever.

His mum, Maureen.

book.Name: Karen
book.Message:
There are so many memories that I have of Sam, most of them with funny stories attached.

Yesterday I found a letter that he wrote me when I was in Australia in 1999. It made me cry til I actually read it, then his account of his needing new clothes and how he was going search through the Next catalogue until he spent his budget made me chuckle. Especially, when he then finished the letter a couple of weeks later having sent most of it back because it didn't fit!

I just wanted to say thanks Sam, for always managing to make me smile. A year on, I still think of you and miss you.

book.Name: Andy Bateman
book.Message:
This Site is for Sam, a friend.  
One that i will miss very much.. 
I hope this site is what you imagined, i'm sorry you're not here to check it and tell me how I can make it better.

book.Name: Bob Pendleton
book.Message: For Sam,student, colleague and friend. Happy times Sam! And every good wish to your Mum, a colleague from my County Hall days, and family. You will always be remembered. - Bob

book.Name: Bill Perry
book.Message: Bye Sam. I never had a chance to say that before you left work for the last time. I've worked with you all your working life. I'll greatly miss your banter, your reminders to me to get things done and your thoughts on how they should be done!! My thoughts are with you and your family at this time. I'll never forget you or the courage you've shown throughout your illness.

book.Name: Guy Fishlock
book.Message: Sam, I have only known you a few years, but in that time we became very close friends. You cheered me up when I was down, you gave me help and advice when I needed it, you were always there for me whenever I needed you. I will remember the good times; nights out in town, barbecues at Greatwood, all the drives we went on, and the funnier times like the occasional car accident or falling through the oven door. Thank you for being such a good, true friend, you will be greatly missed.

book.Name: Matt Hall
book.Message: Trying to find just a few words to put here is very hard... so I will borrow some... "Only his body is in death, that which he gave us lives on" he touched my life as he did many, and I truely believe, that will live forever.

book.Name: Karen
book.Message:
Sam is someone that I am pleased to have known and proud to be able to call my friend. You were a good friend at college and I only wish that we had been better at keeping in touch. With much love, Rest In Peace.

I'm sorry it had to come to this
For me to get in touch
Even though it's been so long
I'll miss you very much

Thought that you were on the mend
When I saw you last
Guess that was a while ago
And time has moved too fast

I know regrets are not allowed
But there is one that I must bear
I'm sorry when friends were called upon
For you I was not there

What I'd give now to hear your voice
Reminisce together about old days
How I'd listen to your sound advice
Wish I had then, in many ways

I guess that means that you were right!!!
I know you'd like that fact!!!
But you would never have dared say so!!!
For you had too much tact!!!

Listen to this doom and gloom
It will not do at all
I've not mentioned all the laughs
All the times we had a ball

Those memories that will stay with me
Of the times that we did share
I will not mention all of them
And some I must not dare!!!!

So now that I have rambled on
In the way I always do
I'll leave this space for others
And their dear memories of you

So thank you for this web site
An ingenious idea
My friend I'll always miss you
And I wish you were still here.

book.Name: Shaun Nikiel
book.Message:
I'd like to thank everyone who knew Sam throughout his life. I know that he valued friendship and respected those around him.

In one of our final conversations I asked Sam what he'd do differently if he could repeat his life. His answer was simply, "nothing!".

Sam's courage should be an inspiration to us all. Cancer and death are feared by most...not Sam.
Sam would want us to take courage from his life and lead ours without prejudice, believing in humanity and most importantly, retaining a sense of perspective whilst keeping a smile on our faces.

book.Name: Chris Conder
book.Message: I hope I can speak for my whole group of friends when I say that I'll miss you Peeps. I'll miss you gatecrashing our parties in your own special way (even when we invited you!), I'll miss ringing you up at the IT help desk when I really couldn't be bothered to walk all that way over there, I'll miss wandering in to see you whenever I made it into Taunton. I think we're all sorry we didn't get to see you before the end, I don't think many of us realised how ill you were, but we'd been thinking about you. I'll always remember you smiling, I can't actually remember even seeing you not.

book.Name: Colin Phillips
book.Message:
To Sam,

The days are darker
Now you're not here to brighten them

My heart is heavier
Now you're not here to cheer it

The nights are longer now
With no hope at dawn

This is all because you're gone.

I will always love you.

Dad.

29th January 2003

book.Name: Malcolm Smith
book.Message:
Thanks Sam for what you meant to me.
For all the years at Ladymead and Huish. We were always close friends. We had great times together with the three of us: You , Adrian and me at st Patricks road.
I have many memories that I treasure and I am proud to have known you and your family. When I think of you, I can only remember good, fun and special times.
I miss you. Thanks for everything.
Your friend always
Malc

book.Name: Shaun Nikiel
book.Message:
Sam,it's been over a year since you left. I think about you every day and wish you were here with us still. I miss you so much.
Your loving brother
Shaun
